meanings.definition: To diminish the effectiveness or power of something.
meanings.sent1: The loud music undercuts my ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather undercuts the joy of our picnic.
meanings.sent3: His constant interruptions undercuts the flow of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments undercuts her confidence like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal undercuts their friendship, leaving a deep wound.

meanings.definition: To sell goods or services at a lower price than a competitor.
meanings.sent1: The store undercuts its prices to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The new supermarket undercuts the prices of the local market.
meanings.sent3: The street vendor undercuts the competition with his affordable prices.
meanings.sent4: The online retailer undercuts all other sellers with its discounts.
meanings.sent5: The company undercuts its rivals, offering the best deals in town.

meanings.definition: A hairstyle in which the hair is cut shorter underneath than on top.
meanings.sent1: She got an undercut to keep her hair off her neck in the summer.
meanings.sent2: The undercut hairstyle has become popular among young adults.
meanings.sent3: His bold undercut drew attention at the party.
meanings.sent4: The undercut gives her a unique and edgy look.
meanings.sent5: The undercut adds a modern twist to her classic style.
